ratings.comment: Cindy was hands down the best professor I've ever had. She is extremely understanding and personable and genuinely wants to get to know you. If you have the chance to take a class with her, do it.
Not a teacher. Just a grader really. Learned very little from this class. She is not very approachable, understanding or really anything you would want from a professor. Take another class.

Cindy put a lot of effort into this class to make sure students are engaged and learning. The class doesn't take a lot of work to get an A. Cindy lets you resubmit projects that you didn't get a good grade on in order to improve your chances at success.

This class was not very useful and was overall a waste of time. The assignments and quizzes were unrelated to what we did in class. Quizzes are all on quizlet. The textbook is "required" for the class but you can get by easily without it; Cindy posts videos with key points from the reading so just save some time and money & don't bother buying it.

This class is really boring. The homework is pretty much the same every week. Cindy doesn't actually teach the class, but I've met her and she is very nice and cares about the students. Kines 119 is just a really dumb class and there isn't much any professor could do better

This class wasn't what I expected. Honestly the first half of the semester was quite boring, the speakers are mostly Researchers trying to explain to the general public what they do. It's basically all presentations and the homework seems to get graded kind of randomly. Tests are online and completely unrelated to presentations in class.
Best professor on campus. Hands down.

Cindy is more excited for this class than any of the students. You go to class once per week to listen to a guest speaker and write a reflection based on their speech. Cindy expects that you do hours of prep work before coming to class, but you can easily pass the class without much work. Don't bother with the textbook, it's not needed to pass.

The c lass is pretty much pointless, but it's a prereq for a lot of kinesiology programs so many will have to take it. If it's not a requirement, do not take this class. Lecture meets once a week, Cindy has speakers from the Kinesiology program come in and speak about your career. Attendance isn't required, grade mostly comes from papers and exams.

Cindy rarely taught the class as a traditional professor. Instead, the class consists of guest speakers coming in once a week to discuss their career in Kinesiology. Easy to get an A, especially if you do the extra credit that is easy to forget about. Don't buy the textbook. Tests are online during weekends with a couple tricky questions.

Class is only once per week and is mostly speakers that come in and talk about their jobs This can be very interesting if you are interested in the field but also very boring Class is pretty much optional go when you are interested in the job Dont buy the textbook bc you can look up answers online Assignments are easy tests online Cindy is nice
Not helpful and condescending. Does not care for students' well-being.

She didn't teach the class, she just had speakers come in and talk about their fields. It was easy and kind of interesting, but it was hard to tell what we would be tested on for the two exams in the class

Cindy is really nice and really enthusiastic about the class! You do some activities that seem very trivial but if you actually reflect on them they are helpful. Definitely take notes on all the lecturers, she pulls questions from their talks for her final which is online and easy AS LONG AS YOU PAY ATTENTION.

There isn't a lot of instruction in this course. It is basically a bunch of speakers whose jobs are related to Kinesiology. Your grade is made up of a group powerpoint, two papers (one that takes little effort), and the final. Also she offered about 10% extra credit for listening to your classmates presentations. DON'T BUY THE TEXTBOOK.

Class itself is really easy. All you do is watch guest speakers and play little games like you are in elementary school again. She's not very helpful at all and your whole grade is a semester long presentation and a final with a couple papers and smaller assignments.

Not a hard class at all. One semester long project that is very easy. No tests except for the final, which is online and super easy. Some of the speakers that come in are interesting, but there are others who are very boring and make the class dull. She enjoys teaching, but her class was honestly a joke.

CIndy is nice and funny. However, she doesn't do most of the teaching.  She has a bunch of guest speakers come in and talk about what they do for a career.  Then you take a final at the end that's worth 30% of your grade that is completely irrelevant to anything she's put any emphasis on.

The class itself with the guest speakers is helpful, but Cindy does little to help, makes you do little clapping activities in class like we're back in kindergarten, and makes a final exam that is hardly relevant at all to any of the class and will only hurt your grade. The weighting of all the assignments is totally out of whack as well.

Expect no help from her in this class, even if you ask multiple times. Also, if you tell her the videos on learn@uw don't work you will be told you are wrong and she wont fix them. The class is easy until you get to the final exam. The final exam is on nothing you learned, impossible to do good on and will tank your grade.

Most unhelpful teacher I've ever had. Class is easy as anything, but a discussion comment that takes 1 minute to write is graded at the same weight as a research paper that takes 5 hours to complete.If Learn@UW glitches and you miss a discussion the highest you can get is a B. Unless this class is required don't take it.

Not extremely difficult to get an AB, but since there is only 1 Exam (worth 30% of your grade) on random facts that are not even studied in class, it is hard to get an A.  You can only lose 7 points in the whole class to maintain an A, as a 93 is an A. Lastly, Cindy will refuse all help you ask of her on essays "because she does not have the time."
Cindy is the greatest! She's funny, exciting, and very kind. The class is extremely easy. Two online quizzes, two papers, and some homework.
